class_notes:
(Same as AMST 190 1)
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only) This course explores U.S History since 1848 through Latinx experiences illustrated in diverse texts produced at national, regional, and local levels. We will engage Latinx cultural productions, print materials (i.e. manifestos), vernacular (hi)stories, and public history projects to uncover how Latinx people have shaped, critiqued, and imagined the history of (and belonging within) the U.S. nation-state. Class themes include, but are not limited to, race, ethnicity, labor, class, politics, gender, region, and culture.
course_description: Introduces first-year students to the discipline of history, particularly historical sources and methods; aims to improve critical reading, analytical, and writing skills in small group discussion.
sections: Class Nbr: 2630, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 1-3:45p, Instructor: I. Rodriguez, Status: Open
